result.execSummary:
The defendant Myracle A Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08. May serve in Brown Co, if sentence imposed and if accepted by Brown Co.

miscConds.notes:
-AODA and any follow up treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety. 
- No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-Defendant to submit to random testing 
-If defendant is able, he is to work 20 hours per week or attend school. 
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

Court costs/attorney fees due during probation term. If not paid in full before termination of probation, defendant to continue to pay $50 per month to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office until paid in full. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay court costs to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office during his probation term on Ct. 1. If payment not made during that time period, he shall commence payments of $50 per month after release from probation term on Ct. 1. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08. If accepted, defendant may serve sentence in Brown County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myracle A Reed

Cases 22CF104-22TR702-22TR703-22TR704 called together - 2:14 PM Defendant Myracle A Reed in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Myracle A Reed. Kristian Lindo appears for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of guilty entered to Ct. 1 & 2 of 22CF104. Court examines defendant finds him guilty and renders sentence. On motion of the County, 22TR702 & 22TR703 dismissed. Plea no contest to OWI 22TR704. court finds defendant guilty and renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Case rescheduled to 10/3 at 1:15 pm.

1:16 PM Defendant Myracle A Reed appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran, Attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defense waives reading of complaint. Defendant does not qualify for the PD.  State recommends $1000 cash bail. Court orders $2500 signature bond w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing. Defendant to submit request for Court Appointed Counsel to the Court by 3/31/2022, if he requests court appointed counsel.
